result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Lee Bearheart Jr

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:02 AM Defendant Brian Lee Bearheart Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill in court for Brian Lee Bearheart Jr.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived formal reading. Not guilt plea is entered. Set for status. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

8:30 AM Defendant Brian Lee Bearheart Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Brian Lee Bearheart Jr in custody in Bayfield.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Gill states DE wants to waive prelim. The Court questions the DE. The Court finds that the DE knowingly and voluntarily waives an in person appearance. The Court questions the DE. The Court finds that the DE knowingly and voluntarily waives his rights. The State requests bind over. The Court finds probable cause. DE is bound over for trial. Set for arraignment. Bond to continue. Adjourned.

8:30 AM Defendant Brian Lee Bearheart Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Brian Lee Bearheart Jr in custody in Bayfield.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Gill states DE wants to waive prelim. The Court questions the DE. The Court finds that the DE knowingly and voluntarily waives an in person appearance. The Court questions the DE. The Court finds that the DE knowingly and voluntarily waives his rights. The State requests bind over. The Court finds probable cause. DE is bound over for trial. Set for arraignment. Bond to continue. Adjourned.
Arraignment scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

8:33 AM Defendant Brian Lee Bearheart Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Brian Lee Bearheart Jr.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Set for prelim.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

12:47 PM Defendant Brian Lee Bearheart Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Brian Lee Bearheart Jr in custody in Barron County.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. The Court calls case and appearances. The Court questions Atty Gill. The Court questions Mr. Bearheart. Atty Marcoux requests $5000 cash bond along with any other provisions in previous bond. Atty Gill makes bond argument. The Court orders $5000 cash bond for both files. Absolute sobriety. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances. No bars, taverns, or liquor stores, or anywhere that sells alcohol on the premises. Not to possess any dangerous weapons. Set for hearing. Adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Return on warrant on June 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:07 PM Defendant Brian Lee Bearheart not in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video means for Defendant Brian Lee Bearheart. Court calls case and appearances. No appearance by defendant. Atty Gill was unable to locate defendant.  State requests warrant-body only and forfieture proceedings to begin. Granted.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Court calls case and appearances. Defendant appears in custody via video from the Washburn County Jail. Atty Ness appears for the Public Defenders Office. Aaron Marcoux appears via phone for the State. Court speaks to Atty Ness. Defendant did decline to speak to the public defenders office. Defendant makes statement, would like to speak w/ the Atty Ness. Off record at 1:03pm. Back on the record at 1:07pm. Atty Ness will make a special appearance for today. Court speaks to the parties and did fine probable cause. State requests $300.00 additional cash. Atty Ness makes argument.
